metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Python MySQL
Python can be used in database applications.
content.html: Python can be used in database applications.

content.text: One of the most popular databases is MySQL.
content.html: One of the most popular databases is MySQL.

content.text: MySQL Database
To be able to experiment with the code examples in this tutorial, you should have MySQL installed on your computer.
content.html: To be able to experiment with the code examples in this tutorial, you should have MySQL installed on your computer.

content.text: You can download a MySQL database at https://www.mysql.com/downloads/ .
content.html: You can download a MySQL database at https://www.mysql.com/downloads/.

content.text: Install MySQL Driver
Python needs a MySQL driver to access the MySQL database.
content.html: Python needs a MySQL driver to access the MySQL database.

content.text: In this tutorial we will use the driver "MySQL Connector".
content.html: In this tutorial we will use the driver "MySQL Connector".

content.text: We recommend that you use PIP to install "MySQL Connector".
content.html: We recommend that you use PIP to install "MySQL Connector".

content.text: PIP is most likely already installed in your Python environment.
content.html: PIP is most likely already installed in your Python environment.

content.text: Navigate your command line to the location of PIP, and type the following:
content.html: Navigate your command line to the location of PIP, and type the following:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36-32\Scripts>python -m pip install mysql-connector-python

content.text: Now you have downloaded and installed a MySQL driver.
content.html: Now you have downloaded and installed a MySQL driver.

content.text: Test MySQL Connector
To test if the installation was successful, or if you already have "MySQL Connector" installed, create a Python page with the following content:
content.html: To test if the installation was successful, or if you already have "MySQL Connector" installed, create a Python page with the following content:

content.code_html: import mysql.connector

content.text: If the above code was executed with no errors, "MySQL Connector" is installed and ready to be used.
content.html: If the above code was executed with no errors, "MySQL Connector" is installed and ready to be used.

content.text: Create Connection
Start by creating a connection to the database.
content.html: Start by creating a connection to the database.

content.text: Use the username and password from your MySQL database:
content.html: Use the username and password from your MySQL database:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
import mysql.connectormydb = mysql.connector.connect(  host="localhost",  user="yourusername",  password="yourpassword")
  print(mydb)

content.code:
import mysql.connectormydb = mysql.connector.connect(  host="localhost",  user="yourusername",  password="yourpassword")
print(mydb)

syntax_highlighting.text:
import mysql.connectormydb = mysql.connector.connect(  host="localhost",  user="yourusername",  password="yourpassword")
 print(mydb)

content.code_html:
import mysql.connector

mydb = mysql.connector.connect(
  host="localhost",
  user="yourusername",
  password="yourpassword"
)

print(mydb)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
import mysql.connectormydb = mysql.connector.connect(  host="localhost",  user="yourusername",  password="yourpassword")
  print(mydb)

content.text: Now you can start querying the database using SQL statements.
content.html: Now you can start querying the database using SQL statements.
